channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #84 - YAPC::NA Training classes announced
item.description:
Hi,

Most of this issue was put together by Yanick, (thanks man!), I only added a few entries and this opening. - I have been waiting for the announcement and I am glad it is out. There are going to be a number of training classes before and after YAPC::NA in the beginning of June. I am responsible for two of the classes. I hope to see many of the Perl Weekly readers at the conference and maybe even in the course.

In the meantime, enjoy the articles!

item.title: Now hiring 25 Perl Developers at Booking.com in Amsterdam (relocation + visa included)
item.description: Do you want to solve real problems of scale involving thousands of servers with various subsystems all deployed multiple times a day? And do you want to work on the largest Perl codebases in the world? Join Booking.com in Amsterdam. Do awesome things.

item.title: MediaMath is hiring Perl Developers: Are you tired of Perl 'scripting'?
item.description: Come join an innovative talented engineering department where you can do some serious Perl programming in a great development environment with clean codebase that is not slapped together. If interested in learning more please contact Marc Spinowitz, Recruiter at MediaMath at mspinowitz@mediamath.com or 646-532-5914

item.title: Dancer and Dancer2 both available on CPAN
item.description: YES! To get the ball rolling, Dancer2 now has its own namespace, and has been released on CPAN. Dancer1 also saw its first release of 2013, and has new maintenance stewards.

item.title: Catalyst Built-in Support for HTTP Method Dispatching and What's Next?
item.description: Like Catalyst? Like REST? John Napiorkowski presents new features of the latest Catalyst, including the option to limit actions to specific HTTP methods.

item.title: Foswiki 1.1.8 released
item.description: As an echo to the TWiki release of last week, Foswiki 1.1.8 is now out.

item.title: Get the most out of YAPC by signing up for Training
item.description: YAPC::NA comes with a neat list of satellite classes and courses. Be sure to have a peek and see if anything's for you in the lot.

item.title: Notes from a Newbie 10: Authentication/Authorization
item.description: This is already the 10th post in what seems to be 'live blogging' while creating a web application using Catalyst on shared hosting.

item.title: Alternative to Test::NoWarnings
item.description: Test::NoWarnings: useful, but flawed. David Golden: pragmatic, but impatient. Say hello to his latest module, Test::FailWarnings.

item.title: Showing Off Template::Caribou
item.description: Timmy had Lassie. What's-her-name had Flipper, and What's-his-face had Skippy. Yanick, it seems, has a pet caribou.

item.title: Module::ExtractUse 0.29
item.description: domm walks us through a bug-hunt through Module::ExtractUse's codebase.

item.title: Visualization of Regular Expression Character Classes
item.description: Quick, what's the difference between [:digit:] and [:xdigit:]? If you are not sure, the pretty graph generated by Peteris Krumins might be able to help you.

item.title: Pod to HTML
item.description: A new Pod to HTML converter is born (Toby Inkster being the happy dad).

item.title: Named regex captures
item.description: Dominic Humphries discovers named captures, and he likes it.

item.title: use constant will surprise you with its evil
item.description: Perl. Constants. Eduardo Arino de la Rubia goes "shake-shake-shake" with that Pandora box.

item.title: Sqitch on Windows (and Linux, Solaris, and OS X)
item.description: Sqitch ALL THE PLATFORMS!

item.title: stop shipping MYMETA to CPAN
item.description: Sometimes, miyagawa reminds us, local crud (like the MYMETA* files) gets bundled in CPAN distributions, something that could easily be prevented by a few judicious lines in the distribution's MANIFEST.SKIP.

item.title: More on constants in perl
item.description: Eduardo Arino de la Rubia continues his quest to find which constant module to use. He's been told that Const::Fast is faster, so he benchmarked it.

item.title: SDL2 C library API is stabilized
item.description: Rejoice, game makers, for Kartik Thakore lets us know that the SDL2 API is stabilizing, and that the work on its Perl bindings is under way.

item.title: POD - Plain Old Documentation
item.description: Gabor offers us a primer on Perl's very own markup mini-language.

item.title: Catalyst Backlog for Next Release on Play Perl
item.description: The title pretty much says it all. Thanks for John Napiorkowski, the list of features for the next Catalyst release is on Play Perl, all ready for your voting and commenting pleasure.

item.title: Introducing cpanm 1.6
item.description: A video introduction of cpanm 1.6 by miyagawa. Brace yourself for an onslaught of awesomeness.

item.title: Git for Ages 4 And Up
item.description: Warm up the popcorn, and prepare to enjoy Schwern's 90 minute presentation on Git.

item.title: All about Perl 6 - interview of Moritz Lenz
Attribute types in Perl classes when using Moose
item.description: Continuing the Moose tutorial.

item.title: German Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: March 13-15, 2013, Berlin, Germany

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: March 22, 2013, Bern, Switzerland

item.title: Dutch Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: April 19, 2013, Arnhem, The Netherlands

item.title: DC Baltimore Perl Workshop
item.description: April 20, 2013, Baltimore, DC, USA
